botanical_details.genus: Passiflora are mostly tender tendril-climbing shrubs, with simple or palmately-lobed, generally evergreen leaves and showy flowers of distinctive structure with often colourful coronal filaments, followed by conspicuous fruits, edible in some species

how_to_grow.cultivation: Fast-growing climber for sun or partial shade, thrives in moist but well-drained soil. Ideal for conservatories; in areas where temperatures drop to below 5-7°C, grow in a container and overwinter indoors see passion flower cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed sown at 13 to 18°C in spring or root semi-hardwood cuttings in summer. Layering can be carried out in spring or autumn
how_to_grow.pruning: Pruning group 11 or pruning group 12 in early spring
how_to_grow.pests: Glasshouse red spider mite, scale insects and glasshouse whitefly may be a problem under glass
